member.summary: Security is provided using HTTPS. The service must be configured with SSL certificates. The SOAP message is protected as a whole using HTTPS. The service is authenticated by the client using the service’s SSL certificate. The client authentication is controlled through the .

member.summary: Security is provided using SOAP message security. For the , the system requires that the server certificate be provided to the client separately. The valid client credential types for this binding are UserName and Certificate.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpSecurityMode.TransportWithMessageCredential
member.summary: Integrity, confidentiality and server authentication are provided by HTTPS. The service must be configured with a certificate. Client authentication is provided by means of SOAP message security. This mode is applicable when the user is authenticating with a UserName or Certificate credential and there is an existing HTTPS deployment for securing message transfer.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.BasicHttpSecurityMode.TransportCredentialOnly
member.summary: This mode does not provide message integrity and confidentiality. It provides only HTTP-based client authentication. Use this mode with caution. It should be used in environments where the transfer security is being provided by other means (such as IPSec) and only client authentication is provided by the infrastructure.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.ConcurrencyMode
member.summary: Specifies whether a service class supports single-threaded or multi-threaded modes of operation.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.ConcurrencyMode.Single
member.summary: The service instance is single-threaded and does not accept reentrant calls. If the property is , and additional messages arrive while the instance services a call, these messages must wait until the service is available or until the messages time out.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.ConcurrencyMode.Reentrant
member.summary: The service instance is single-threaded and accepts reentrant calls. The reentrant service accepts calls when you call another service; it is therefore your responsibility to leave your object state consistent before callouts and you must confirm that operation-local data is valid after callouts. Note that the service instance is unlocked only by calling another service over a channel. In this case, the called service can reenter the first service via a callback. If the first service is not reentrant, the sequence of calls results in a deadlock. For details, see .

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.ConcurrencyMode.Multiple
member.summary: The service instance is multi-threaded. No synchronization guarantees are made. Because other threads can change your service object at any time, you must handle synchronization and state consistency at all times.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.ReceiveErrorHandling
member.summary: An enumeration that specifies handling for a poison message.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.ReceiveErrorHandling.Fault
member.summary: This option sends a fault to the listener that caused the ServiceHost to fault. The message must be removed from the application queue by some external mechanism before the application can continue to process messages from the queue.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.ReceiveErrorHandling.Drop
member.summary: This option drops the poison message. The message never gets delivered to the application. If the message's TTL had already expired at this point, then the message may appear in the sender's Dead Letter Queue. If not, the message does not appear anywhere. This option indicates that the user does not really care if the message is lost.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.ReceiveErrorHandling.Reject
member.summary: This instructs MSMQ to send a negative acknowledgement back to the sending queue manager that the message cannot be received by the application. The message is placed in the sending queue manager's Dead Letter Queue.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.ReceiveErrorHandling.Move
member.summary: This moves the poison message to a Poison Message Queue for later processing by a poison message handling application.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode
member.summary: Specifies the different security modes for .

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode.None
member.summary: The SOAP message is not secure during transfer. No Security Token Service is contacted. This mode is equivalent to using the wsHttpBinding binding with SecurityMode.None.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode.Message
member.summary: Integrity, confidentiality, server authentication and client authentication are provided using SOAP message security. By default, the body is encrypted and signed. The service must be configured with a certificate. Client authentication is based on the token issued to the client by a security token service.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.WSFederationHttpSecurityMode.TransportWithMessageCredential
member.summary: Integrity, confidentiality and server authentication are provided by HTTPS. The service must be configured with a certificate. Client authentication is provided by means of SOAP message security and is based on the token issued to the client by a security token service.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.Channels.BufferManager
member.summary: Many features require the use of buffers, which are expensive to create and destroy. You can use the class to manage a buffer pool. The pool and its buffers are created when you instantiate this class and destroyed when the buffer pool is reclaimed by garbage collection. Every time you need to use a buffer, you take one from the pool, use it, and return it to the pool when done. This process is much faster than creating and destroying a buffer every time you need to use one.

The maximum size of an individual buffer.
member.exception: There was insufficient memory to create the requested buffer pool.

member.exception: Length of does not match the pool's buffer length property.

member.summary: Gets a buffer of at least the specified size from the pool.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure
member.summary: Specifies the possible types of delivery failure for a message read from the queue.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure.Unknown
member.summary: An unknown error occurred.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure.AccessDenied
member.summary: The sender does not have access rights to place messages in the destination queue.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure.BadDestinationQueue
member.summary: The destination queue was not found.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure.BadEncryption
member.summary: The destination queue manager cannot decrypt the message.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure.BadSignature
member.summary: The destination queue manager cannot authenticate the message because the attached signature is invalid.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure.CouldNotEncrypt
member.summary: The source queue manager cannot encrypt the message.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure.HopCountExceeded
member.summary: The message hop count was exceeded, which indicates the number of intermediate servers.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure.NotTransactionalQueue
member.summary: A transactional message was sent to a nontransactional queue.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure.NotTransactionalMessage
member.summary: A nontransactional message was sent to a transactional queue.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure.Purged
member.summary: The message was purged before reaching the destination queue.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure.QueueDeleted
member.summary: The destination queue was deleted before the message could be delivered to the application.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure.QueueExceedMaximumSize
member.summary: The message was not delivered because the destination queue is full.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure.QueuePurged
member.summary: The queue was purged and the message no longer exists.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure.ReachQueueTimeout
member.summary: The message did not reach the destination queue before timing out.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryFailure.ReceiveTimeout
member.summary: The message was not delivered to the application on time.

member.name: T:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryStatus
member.summary: An enumeration that specifies the delivery status of a message when the delivery of the message is in doubt, or when the message was not delivered.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryStatus.InDoubt
member.summary: The delivery of the message is in doubt.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.DeliveryStatus.NotDelivered
member.summary: The message was not delivered.

member.summary: Describes the layout of the security header.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityHeaderLayout.Strict
member.summary: Items are added to the security header according to the general principle of “declare before use”.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityHeaderLayout.Lax
member.summary: Items are added to the security header in any order that confirms to WSS: SOAP Message security.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityHeaderLayout.LaxTimestampFirst
member.summary: Items are added to the security header in any order that confirms to WSS: SOAP Message security except that the first element in the security header must be a wsse:Timestamp element.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Channels.SecurityHeaderLayout.LaxTimestampLast
member.summary: Items are added to the security header in any order that confirms to WSS: SOAP Message security except that the last element in the security header must be a wsse:Timestamp element.

member.summary: Specifies that the initiator is anonymous, and that the responder is authenticated.

member.summary: Specifies that the initiator is anonymous.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.AuthenticationMode.CertificateOverTransport
member.summary: Specifies that the initiator is authenticated by an X.509 version 3 certificate, and that the responder is authenticated by SSL over HTTPS.

member.summary: Specifies that the initiator and responder are authenticated by XML symmetric key tokens.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.AuthenticationMode.IssuedTokenForCertificate
member.summary: Specifies that the initiator is authenticated by an XML symmetric key token, and that the responder is authenticated by an X.509 version 3 certificate.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.AuthenticationMode.IssuedTokenForSslNegotiated
member.summary: Specifies that the initiator is authenticated by an XML symmetric key token, and that the responder is authenticated by the SOAP implementation of SSL.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.AuthenticationMode.IssuedTokenOverTransport
member.summary: Specifies that the initiator is authenticated by an XML symmetric key token, and that the responder is authenticated by SSL over HTTPS.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.AuthenticationMode.Kerberos
member.summary: Specifies that the initiator and responder are authenticated using the Kerberos protocol.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.AuthenticationMode.KerberosOverTransport
member.summary: Specifies that the initiator is authenticated using the Kerberos protocol, and the responder is authenticated by SSL over HTTPS.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.AuthenticationMode.MutualCertificate
member.summary: Specifies that the initiator and responder are authenticated with X.509 version 3 certificates.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.AuthenticationMode.MutualCertificateDuplex
member.summary: Specifies that the initiator and responder are authenticated with X.509 version 3 certificates.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.AuthenticationMode.MutualSslNegotiated
member.summary: Specifies that the initiator and responder mutually authenticate each other using X509 version 3 certificates, and the responder's certificate is available from the SOAP SSL negotiation.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.AuthenticationMode.SecureConversation
member.summary: Specifies that WS-SecureConversation authentication is used.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.AuthenticationMode.SspiNegotiated
member.summary: Specifies that the initiator and responder obtain a shared security context using the Security Service Provider Interface (SSPI).

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.AuthenticationMode.UserNameForCertificate
member.summary: Specifies that the initiator is authenticated using a username token, and the responder's certificate is available to the initiator out-of-band.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.AuthenticationMode.UserNameForSslNegotiated
member.summary: Specifies that the initiator is authenticated using a username token, and that the responder is authenticated by the SOAP implementation of SSL.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.AuthenticationMode.UserNameOverTransport
member.summary: Specifies that the initiator is authenticated using a username token, and that the responder is authenticated by SSL over HTTPS.

member.name: F:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.AuthenticationMode.SspiNegotiatedOverTransport
member.summary: Specifies that the initiator is authenticated by a security context using the Security Service Provider Interface (SSPI), and the responder is authenticated by SSL over HTTPS.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.MsmqBindingElementBase.ReceiveContextEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies if receive context for processing messages in queues is enabled. When this is enabled, a service can “peek” a message on the queue to begin processing it, and, if anything goes wrong and an exception is thrown, it remains on the queue. Services can also “lock” messages in order to retry processing at a later point in time. ReceiveContext provides a mechanism for “completing” the message once processed so it can be removed from the queue.Messages are no longer being read and re-written to queues over the network, and individual messages aren’t bouncing across different service instances during processing.
member.returns: Returns .

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.MsmqBindingElementBase.ReceiveErrorHandling
member.summary: Gets or sets an enumeration value that specifies how poison and messages that cannot be dispatched are handled.
member.returns: A value that specifies how poison and messages that cannot be dispatched are handled.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.MsmqBindingElementBase.ReceiveRetryCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of immediate retries that the queue manager should attempt if transmission of a message from the application queue to the application fails.
member.returns: The maximum number of times the queue manager should attempt to send a message before transferring it to the retry queue.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.MsmqBindingElementBase.RetryCycleDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how long to wait before attempting another retry cycle when attempting to deliver a message that could not be delivered.
member.returns: The that specifies the interval of time to wait before starting the next cycle of delivery attempts to the receiving application. The default value is 30 (minutes).

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.MsmqBindingElementBase.TimeToLive
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies how long messages are valid. When this time has elapsed, the message is placed in a dead-letter queue (if available).
member.returns: A value that specifies how long messages are valid. The default value is 24 hours.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that enables or disables the Message Queuing (also known as MSMQ) built-in message tracing facility.
member.returns: A value that enables or disables the Message Queuing built-in message tracing facility.

member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether copies of messages processed by this binding should be stored in the source journal queue.
member.returns: true if messages processed by this binding are copied to the source journal queue; otherwise, false. The default value is false.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.MsmqBindingElementBase.ValidityDuration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies a connection time-out when used with queued channels.
member.returns: A .

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.MsmqElementBase.ReceiveContextEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that specifies if receive context for processing messages in queues is enabled. When this is true, a service can “peek” a message on the queue to begin processing it, and, if anything goes wrong and an exception is thrown, it remains on the queue. Services can also “lock” messages in order to retry processing at a later point in time. ReceiveContext provides a mechanism for “completing” the message once processed so it can be removed from the queue. Messages are no longer being read and re-written to queues over the network, and individual messages aren’t bouncing across different service instances during processing.
member.returns: Returns .

member.summary: Gets or sets an enumeration value that specifies how poison and nondispatchable messages are handled.
member.returns: A value that specifies how poison and nondispatchable messages are handled.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.MsmqElementBase.ReceiveRetryCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of times that the queue manager should attempt to send a message before transferring it to the retry queue.
member.returns: A 32-bit signed integer that specifies the maximum number of times that the queue manager should attempt to send a message before transferring it to the retry queue.

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.MsmqElementBase.RetryCycleDelay
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the time delay between retry cycles when attempting to deliver a message that could not be delivered immediately.
member.returns: The that specifies the interval of time to wait before starting the next cycle of delivery attempts to the receiving application. The default value is "00:10:00".

member.name: P:System.ServiceModel.Configuration.MsmqElementBase.TimeToLive
member.summary: Gets or sets the interval of time that indicates how long the messages processed by this binding can be in the queue before they expire.
member.returns: The that indicates how long the messages can be in the queue before they expire. The default value is one day (01:00:00:00).

member.summary: Gets or sets a Boolean value that indicates whether messages processed by this binding should be traced.
member.returns: true if messages processed by this binding should be traced; otherwise, false. The default is false.

member.returns: true if copies of messages processed by this binding should be stored in the source journal queue; otherwise, false. The default is false.
